## IP

```

```lua
--ip
function JudgeIPString(ipStr)
    if type(ipStr) ~= "string" then
        return false;
    end
    
    --
    local len = string.len(ipStr);
    if len < 7 or len > 15 then --
        return false;
    end
 
    --
    local point = string.find(ipStr, "%p", 1); --"."
    local pointNum = 0; --"." ip3"."
    while point ~= nil do
        if string.sub(ipStr, point, point) ~= "." then --"."
            return false;
        end
        pointNum = pointNum + 1;
        point = string.find(ipStr, "%p", point + 1);
        if pointNum > 3 then
            return false;
        end
    end
    if pointNum ~= 3 then --ip
        return false;
    end
 
    --
    local num = {};
    for w in string.gmatch(ipStr, "%d+") do
        num[#num + 1] = w;
        local kk = tonumber(w);
        if kk == nil or kk > 255 then --ip
            return false;
        end
    end
 
    if #num ~= 4 then --4
        return false;
    end
 
    return ipStr;
end
```

IP

#  [0, 65535]
import socket, struct
socket.inet_ntoa(struct.pack("!I", ip))  #  int -> str
--ip
function JudgeIPString(ipStr)
    if type(ipStr) ~= "string" then
        return false;
    end
    
    --
    local len = string.len(ipStr);
    if len < 7 or len > 15 then --
        return false;
    end
 
    --
    local point = string.find(ipStr, "%p", 1); --"."
    local pointNum = 0; --"." ip3"."
    while point ~= nil do
        if string.sub(ipStr, point, point) ~= "." then --"."
            return false;
        end
        pointNum = pointNum + 1;
        point = string.find(ipStr, "%p", point + 1);
        if pointNum > 3 then
            return false;
        end
    end
    if pointNum ~= 3 then --ip
        return false;
    end
 
    --
    local num = {};
    for w in string.gmatch(ipStr, "%d+") do
        num[#num + 1] = w;
        local kk = tonumber(w);
        if kk == nil or kk > 255 then --ip
            return false;
        end
    end
 
    if #num ~= 4 then --4
        return false;
    end
 
    return ipStr;
end

#  [0, 65535]
import socket, struct
socket.inet_ntoa(struct.pack("!I", ip))  #  int -> str
--ip
function JudgeIPString(ipStr)
    if type(ipStr) ~= "string" then
        return false;
    end
    
    --
    local len = string.len(ipStr);
    if len < 7 or len > 15 then --
        return false;
    end
 
    --
    local point = string.find(ipStr, "%p", 1); --"."
    local pointNum = 0; --"." ip3"."
    while point ~= nil do
        if string.sub(ipStr, point, point) ~= "." then --"."
            return false;
        end
        pointNum = pointNum + 1;
        point = string.find(ipStr, "%p", point + 1);
        if pointNum > 3 then
            return false;
        end
    end
    if pointNum ~= 3 then --ip
        return false;
    end
 
    --
    local num = {};
    for w in string.gmatch(ipStr, "%d+") do
        num[#num + 1] = w;
        local kk = tonumber(w);
        if kk == nil or kk > 255 then --ip
            return false;
        end
    end
 
    if #num ~= 4 then --4
        return false;
    end
 
    return ipStr;
end
